title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 23 ยง 201.3 - Acting Without a Registration
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 23 ยง 201.3 - Acting Without a Registration

State Regulations
(a) No
individual, firm, association, corporation or other entity may engage in the
business of a consumer credit reporting agency in New York by furnishing a
consumer credit report on a New York consumer to any individual or entity
without having a valid registration as a consumer credit reporting agency filed
with Section 201.02 of this Part unless the individual, firm, association, corporation or other entity is not required to be registered pursuant to
section 201.02(a) of this Part. (b) No regulated person may pay any fee or other compensation to any consumer
credit reporting agency that is required to be registered pursuant to section
201.02(a) of this Part but fails to possess the required
registration. (c) No regulated
person may transmit any information about a resident of New York State to a
consumer credit reporting agency that is required to be registered pursuant to
section 201.02(a) of this Part but fails to possess the required
registration. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 23
ยง
201.3

Adopted

New

York State Register July 3, 2018/Volume XL, Issue 27, eff. 7/3/2018

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
